thread.title: Rock Band 3 Export for Rock Band 4 Coming Later This Year
thread.title_full: Rock Band 3 Export for Rock Band 4 Coming Later This Year

author: Luke Reilly
title: Rock Band 3 Export for Rock Band 4 Coming Later This Year
text:
Rock Band 3 Export for Rock Band 4 Coming Later This Year Share. By Luke Reilly 
Harmonix has confirmed via a post on its blog that Rock Band 3 tracks will be exportable into Rock Band 4. The team is working to have this process available with the planned December 8 feature update. 
It was known that previous Rock Band game disc exports would be made available to load into Rock Band 4 (with the exception of The Beatles: Rock Band, which was never enabled for export) but as there had never been an export key made available for Rock Band 3 , whether tracks from that would ever make the jump remained up in the air. 
Harmonix notes that it is “rapidly approaching the expiration” of its rights to sell Rock Band 3, so if you don’t have a copy of Rock Band 3 you’ll have until October 30 to buy it from the Xbox Live Marketplace, “or until traditional retailers run out of stock.” The studio also notes that any tracks from the Rock Band 3 disc with authored guitar solos will feature upgraded Freestyle Guitar Solo and Freestyle Vocal features. Hello, Free Bird. 
The Rock Band 3 export key will be available for USD$14.99 for people who are “verified purchasers” of Rock Band 3. Harmonix explains that it will be “automatically verifying your purchase electronically, which means that you’ll need to have bought a new copy and played Rock Band 3 for [the] export process to work.” 
Harmonix is still working on supporting previous Rock Band exports in Rock Band 4 and hopes to have that content available for players “later on”. The chart below may offer a little more clarity. 
IGN’s review called Rock Band 4 “every bit the magical cooperative gaming experience the series has always been.”
